history.content:
There are some classes or class sections that are being reviewed to be offered in-person on campus. The review process has been very rigorous (department, college, and now Chancellor-office reviews). My understanding is that the review process is supposed to wrap-up next week so it's unclear if the classes you describe have been approved or if the room designation is left over. (We had to reserve rooms in case we could hold classes in person.)

My suggestion is to go back to classes.berkeley.edu and read the CLASS NOTES for these classes to see what the individual plans are for each class in SP21. Most Schedulers are noting the actual class format there.

children.subject:
None of the four classes I've mentioned say anything about their mode of instruction (in-person or online) in the Class Notes section.

Also, will we be notified when the review process finishes next week? When it does finish, where would we go to check if any labs are being done in-person?

history.content: I've looked at the course catalog for classes like Physics 8a & 8b, and EE 130 & 105, and it lists on-campus rooms for most of the lab sections. I was told that almost all instruction would be done remotely, so are those labs going to be updated?
history.subject: Are lab sections going to be remote or on-campus?
